bibl.title: Letter from Rupert Blue to Henry Rose Carter, July 3, 1917

div1.p: Blue orders Carter to assist U.S. Navy officials with mosquito control at Quantico, Virginia.

div1.head: Letter from Rupert Blue to Henry Rose Carter, July 3, 1917
div1.opener:
OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL
IN REPLYING
ADDRESS THE SURGEON GENERAL
U. S. PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
CD
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
BUREAU OF
THE PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
WASHINGTON
July 3, 1917.
Assistant Surgeon General H. R. Carter,
Hotel Petersburg,
Petersburg, Va.
Sir:
div1.p:
The following Bureau telegram of today is hereby con-
firmed.

Surgeon General Navy wishes you to offer advice regard-
ing mosquito control both inside and outside Quantico camp.
Get in touch with commanding medical officer and extend
active cooperation.”

It is the desire of the Bureau to be of assistance to
the Naval medical authorities in connection with the sani-
tary surveys now being conducted. Your report on conditions
at Quantico with recommendations about the matter is there-
fore being awaited with interest in order to determine what
further action may be taken.
